results.title: News parade of the year 1948
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: A record of international events that shaped the news in 1948. WEST’S WORST FLOODS captures the Pacific northwest floods that affected Canada and the USA and the hurricanes which battered Florida’s coast. HOLLAND’S NEW QUEEN focuses on Queen Wilhemina’s abdication in favour of her daughter Juliana. BERLIN CRISIS reports on the coal and food supplies stalled by the Russian blockade of Berlin and USA’s efforts to deliver supplies by air. Also looks at violence in the streets between communists and West Germans. COAL STRIKE GRIPS FRANCE and triggers violence in the streets of France. PALESTINE CONFLICT focuses on international efforts to ease Arab-Israeli conflicts, includes brief footage on women in the Israeli army. REVOLT IN BOGOTA captures the violence caused by the political climate in Columbia. US AIR GROWTH looks at the growth and development of the aviation industry. PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION focuses on the 1948 candidates.

results.title: News parade of the year 1947
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: A record of international events that shaped the news in 1947. AFRICA HAILS ROYAL FAMILY shows the British Royal Family greeted by 5,000 Zulu warriors. STRIFE IN KOREA. PALESTINE CRISIS. US PRESIDENT”S GOOD WILL VISIT records President Truman’s visit to Mexico, Ottawa and Rio de Janiero. ROUND THE WORLD SOLO RECORD captures Bill Oden’s attempt to smash his own round-the-world flight record. NATURE ON RAMPAGE shows spring floods wreaking havoc in Warsaw as ice demolishes a railway bridge. HURRICANE RIPS EAST COAST presents Florida’s east coast being savaged by a hurricane. ROYAL ROMANCE follows Princess Elizabeth and Prince Phillip before their marriage. YANKS CAPTURE WORLD SERIES presents the highlights from the World Series final. TEXAS CITY DISASTER reports on the devastation caused by the explosion of a French freighter loaded with amonium nitrate, injuring 3,000 and killing 408.

results.title: News Parade of the year 1946
results.brief_description: A summary of the main events of 1946 as captured in newsreels. 1. WARS AFTERMATH AROUND THE WORLD consists of ‘Philippines free’ showing General MacArthur returning to Manila to witness the inauguration of first President Roxas. ‘Italian republic proclaimed amid violence and turmoil’ records protests in Italy. ‘Turmoil in Trieste’ shows American and British soldiers confronted by protestors in a disputed port. ‘Unrest in Palestine’ shows thousands of Jewish refugees denied entrance to the Holy Land. ‘Nurenberg trials’ records the sentencing of Nazis. 2. BELGIAN PLANE DISASTER 3. CANADA’S NEW GOVENOR GENERAL 4. THIRTY-TWO NEW CARDINALS 5. PARIS PEACE CONFERENCE 6. AUTOS” GOLDEN JUBILEE 7. GREAT TURF CLASSIC shows the Kentucky Derby. 8. YEAR’S AIR PROGRESS 9. NAVY DEMONSTRATES LATEST RADAR-CONTROLLED FLYING BOMB ‘THE BAT’ 10. ATOMIC BOMBING AT BIKINI 11. ATOMIC BOMB BLAST #5 captures the first underwater atomic bomb test.

results.title: News hounds
results.creator_credit: Sarah Curtis, BBC Film Unit, Working Title Films and Leslie Blair
results.brief_description: A satiric look at the world of tabloid journalism in Britain. ‘The Brit’ is a muckraking tabloid newspaper that will stop at nothing in its thirst for scandal. The way the paper constructs its front page expose of two sex-scandal stories that emerge on the same day - one involving a cabinet minister and the other a soapie star - reveals much about the state of journalism and politics in England at the end of the eighties. (Awards: British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) Award for Best Single Television Drama, 1990). Cast includes Adrian Edmondson, Alison Steadman, Linda Bassett and Christopher Fulford.

results.title: News digest [No. 8]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Silent players at Benalla - headquarters of the Gliding Club of Victoria; antique pistols are shown by collectors of arms; a bullock team at work hauling timber at Yellingbo; an old Chinese market gardener on his daily round; and a student riding the monocycle he made.

results.title: News digest [No. 7]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Melbourne police patrol use bicycles at night to help prevent thefts; champion highland dancer demonstrates the Highland fling and sward dance as he teaches his pupils; the history of flight from Leonardo da Vinci to space travel; water skiers ingenuity at Quandong.

results.title: News digest [No. 6]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Champion wood chopper Jack O’Toole in action; attraction of Lake Eppalock for picnics, boating, water sports and trout fishing for all water sport enthusiasts; exhibition of historic locomotives; bumper wheat crop at Werrimul; newly discovered scallop beds in Port Phillip Bay.

results.title: News digest [No. 5]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Demonstrates the usefulness of a helicopter for fire-spotting, and foam for extinguishing a car fire; Streeton’s descendants open his old home to the public, show many paintings; Latrobe Valley Aero Club caters for country flyers; at Harcourt an old sailor remembers the past as he models sailing ships.
